00001 #include <malloc.h>
00002 #include <stdio.h>
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 #include <string.h>
00005 #include "base.h"

00008 #include "mem.h"
00009 #include "pk.h"
00010 
00011 /*
00012  * __bsearch_compare
00013  *
00014  * Comparison function used when we call bsearch to look for a key in our array.
00015  * It works like __qsort_compare, however /a/ is just a character here, but a
00016  * primary_key structure in __qsort_compare.
00017  */
00018 static int __bsearch_compare(const void* a, const void* b)
00019 {
00020   return strcmp( (char*)a, ((PrimaryKeyRecord*)b)->name );
00021 }
00022 
00023 /*
00024  * __qsort_compare
00025  *
00026  * Comparison function used when we call qsort in our primary keys array.
00027  * It just calls strncmp on primary_key's name member.
00028  */
00029 static int __qsort_compare(const void* a, const void* b)
00030 {
00031   return strncmp( ((PrimaryKeyRecord*)a)->name, ((PrimaryKeyRecord*)b)->name, TITLE_LENGTH );
00032 }
00033 
00034 /*
00035  * pkListInflateSize
00036  *
00037  * Function used internally. It allocates more memory for our primary keys
00038  * list, doubling the space used each time it is called.
00039  *
00040  * Returns 1 on error and 0 otherwise.
00041  */
00042 static int pkListInflateSize(PrimaryKeyList* index) {
00043   PrimaryKeyRecord* tmp;
00044 
00045   tmp = realloc(index->pklist, (index->maxregs*2)*sizeof(PrimaryKeyRecord));
00046 
00047   if (tmp == NULL)
00048     return 1;
00049   else {
00050     index->pklist = tmp; 
00051     index->maxregs = index->maxregs*2;
00052   }
00053 
00054   return 0;
00055 }
00056 
00057 PrimaryKeyList* pkListInit(void) {
00058   PrimaryKeyList* ret;
00059 
00060   ret = MEM_ALLOC(PrimaryKeyList); /* Alocating the PK list struct. */
00061   ret->regnum = 0;
00062   ret->maxregs = 20; /* Initial size of the base */
00063 
00064   /* Alocate the actual PK list, for the first time. */
00065   ret->pklist = MEM_ALLOC_N(PrimaryKeyRecord, ret->maxregs); 
00066 
00067   if (ret->pklist == NULL) {
00068     free(ret);
00069     return NULL; 
00070   }
00071 
00072   return ret;
00073 }
00074 
00075 void pkListFree(PrimaryKeyList* index) {
00076   if (index) {
00077     /* PrimaryKeyList* points to a struct, 
00078      * so we must free the struct's pointers first.
00079      */
00080     free(index->pklist);
00081     free(index);
00082     index = NULL;
00083   }
00084 }
00085 
00086 int pkListFindByName(PrimaryKeyList* index, const char* key) {
00087   PrimaryKeyRecord* match;
00088 
00089   /* This will use bsearch to find the key. */
00090   match = bsearch(key, index->pklist, index->regnum,
00091                   sizeof(PrimaryKeyRecord),
00092                   __bsearch_compare);
00093 
00094   if (match == NULL)
00095     return -1;
00096   else
00097     return match->rrn;
00098 }
00099 
00100 int pkListInsert(PrimaryKeyList* index, const char* name) {
00101   /* If the name is already on the list, do not add it again */
00102   if (pkListFindByName(index, name) != -1)
00103     return 1;
00104 
00105   /* If we need more space on the list, inflate it */
00106   if (index->regnum == index->maxregs) {
00107     if (pkListInflateSize(index)) /* If we had problems inflating the index. */
00108       return 1;
00109   }
00110 
00111   /* New register's rrn is the number of registers, 
00112    * since it's added to the end. */
00113   index->pklist[index->regnum].rrn = index->regnum; 
00114   /* Then we copy the key, in this case the name, to the PK index. */
00115   strncpy(index->pklist[index->regnum].name, name, TITLE_LENGTH+1);
00116 
00117   index->regnum++;
00118   
00119   /* Must keep it sorted. */
00120   qsort(index->pklist, index->regnum, 
00121         sizeof(PrimaryKeyRecord), __qsort_compare);
00122 
00123   return 0;
00124 }
00125 
00126 int pkListIsEmpty(PrimaryKeyList* index) {
00127   if (index)
00128     return index->regnum == 0;
00129   else
00130     return 1;
00131 }
00132 
00133 int pkListLoadFromBase(PrimaryKeyList* index, FILE* base) {
00134   int basepos;
00135   int i;
00136 
00137   if ((base == NULL) || (index == NULL))
00138     return 1;
00139 
00140   basepos = ftell(base);
00141   index->regnum = getFileSize(base) / REG_SIZE;
00142 
00143   /* While we have more registers to store than available space,
00144      we keep inflating our list.*/
00145   while (index->regnum > index->maxregs) {
00146     if (pkListInflateSize(index))
00147       return 1;
00148   }
00149   
00150   /* Next we read the registers from our base. */
00151   for (i = 0; i < index->regnum; i++) {
00152     fgets(index->pklist[i].name, TITLE_LENGTH, base);
00153     index->pklist[i].rrn = i;
00154 
00155     /* Strip trailing whitespaces from the name */
00156     stripWhiteSpace(index->pklist[i].name);
00157 
00158     /* Since we need to skip the rest of the register, and have already
00159      * read TITLE_LENGTH, we must go REG_SIZE - TITLE_LENGTH positions ahead,
00160      * and yet one more for we must read the next name. */
00161     fseek(base, (REG_SIZE - TITLE_LENGTH)+1, SEEK_CUR);
00162   }
00163 
00164   /* After everything is added, it has to be sorted. */
00165   qsort(index->pklist, index->regnum, sizeof(PrimaryKeyRecord), __qsort_compare);
00166 
00167   fseek(base, basepos, SEEK_SET);
00168 
00169   return 0;
00170 }
00171 
00172 int pkListLoadFromPK(PrimaryKeyList* index, FILE* pkfile) {
00173   char tmpname[TITLE_LENGTH+1], tmprrn[RRN_LENGTH+1];
00174   int i, rrn;
00175   int pkfilepos;
00176 
00177   if (pkfile == NULL)
00178     return 1;
00179 
00180   pkfilepos = ftell(pkfile);
00181 
00182   index->regnum = getFileSize(pkfile) / PK_REG_SIZE;
00183 
00184   /* While we have more registers to store than available space,
00185    * we keep inflating our list. */
00186   while (index->regnum > index->maxregs) {
00187     if (pkListInflateSize(index))
00188       return 1;
00189   }
00190   
00191   for (i = 0; i < index->regnum; i++) {
00192     fgets(tmpname, TITLE_LENGTH+1, pkfile);
00193     strncpy(index->pklist[i].name, tmpname, TITLE_LENGTH);
00194 
00195     /* Strip trailing whitespaces from the name */
00196     stripWhiteSpace(index->pklist[i].name);
00197 
00198     fgets(tmprrn, RRN_LENGTH+1, pkfile);
00199     rrn = atoi(tmprrn);
00200     index->pklist[i].rrn = rrn;
00201   }
00202 
00203   /* Change the pointer to it's original position. */
00204   fseek(pkfile, pkfilepos, SEEK_SET);
00205 
00206   return 0;
00207 }
00208 
00209 void pkListWriteToFile(PrimaryKeyList* index, FILE* pkfile) {
00210   char write_str[20] = {'\0'};
00211   int i;
00212   
00213   if (pkfile) {
00214     for (i = 0; i < index->regnum; i++) {
00215       /* We write the format string for fprintf at write_str.
00216        * This takes the sizes for the fields. */
00217       sprintf(write_str, "%%-%ds%%0%dd", TITLE_LENGTH, RRN_LENGTH);
00218       fprintf(pkfile, write_str, index->pklist[i].name, index->pklist[i].rrn);
00219     }
00220   }
00221 }
